User Guides & TutorialsÂ¶

Welcome to the DIP SMC PSO framework documentation! This guide will help you navigate the documentation and find what you need.

Quick NavigationÂ¶

ğŸš€ Getting StartedÂ¶

Start here if youâ€™re new to the framework

ğŸ“˜ User GuideÂ¶

Comprehensive reference for daily usage

  • User Guide Core workflows, configuration, PSO optimization, result analysis

ğŸ“š Tutorial SeriesÂ¶

Step-by-step learning path

  1. Tutorial 01: Your First Simulation Learn DIP system, run classical SMC, interpret results (30-45 min)

  2. Tutorial 02: Controller Comparison Compare 4 core SMC controllers, understand tradeoffs, select optimal controller (45-60 min)

  3. Tutorial 03: PSO Optimization Automatic gain tuning, convergence analysis, custom cost functions (60-90 min)

  4. Tutorial 04: Custom Controller Development Implement Terminal SMC from scratch, factory integration, testing (90-120 min)

  5. Tutorial 05: Research Workflow End-to-end research project, statistical analysis, publication workflow (120+ min)

ğŸ”§ How-To GuidesÂ¶

Task-oriented recipes for specific workflows

  • Running Simulations CLI usage, Streamlit dashboard, programmatic API, batch processing

  • Result Analysis Metrics interpretation, statistical analysis, visualization, data export

  • Optimization Workflows PSO tuning, custom cost functions, convergence diagnostics, parallel execution

  • Testing & Validation Test suite, unit testing, performance benchmarking, coverage analysis

ğŸ“ Theory & ExplanationÂ¶

Understanding-oriented guides that explain the â€œwhyâ€ behind the framework

  • PSO Algorithm Theory Swarm intelligence principles, convergence theory, parameter selection, benchmarks (438 lines)

  • Double-Inverted Pendulum Dynamics Lagrangian derivation, equations of motion, linearization, controllability (501 lines)

Learning PathsÂ¶

Path 1: Quick Start (1-2 hours)Â¶

Perfect for: First-time users, quick prototyping

  1. Getting Started â†’ Install & run first simulation

  2. Tutorial 01 â†’ Understand DIP & SMC basics

  3. How-To: Running Simulations â†’ Explore CLI and Streamlit options

Path 2: Controller Expert (4-6 hours)Â¶

Perfect for: Control systems researchers, comparative studies

  1. Getting Started â†’ Setup

  2. Tutorial 01 â†’ Basics

  3. Tutorial 02 â†’ Compare controllers

  4. Tutorial 03 â†’ Optimize gains

  5. How-To: Optimization Workflows â†’ Advanced PSO tuning

Path 3: Custom Development (8-12 hours)Â¶

Perfect for: Implementing novel SMC algorithms

  1. Getting Started â†’ Setup

  2. Tutorial 01-02 â†’ Learn framework basics

  3. Tutorial 04 â†’ Implement custom controller

  4. Tutorial 03 â†’ Optimize custom controller

  5. How-To: Testing & Validation â†’ Comprehensive testing

Path 4: Research Publication (12+ hours)Â¶

Perfect for: Graduate students, researchers

  1. Complete Paths 1-2 (understand framework & controllers)

  2. Tutorial 05 â†’ End-to-end research project

  3. How-To: Result Analysis â†’ Statistical validation and visualization

  4. User Guide - Batch Processing â†’ Monte Carlo studies

Quick ReferenceÂ¶

Most Common CommandsÂ¶

# Run simulation
python simulate.py --ctrl classical_smc --plot

# Optimize gains
python simulate.py --ctrl classical_smc --run-pso --save gains.json

# Test optimized gains
python simulate.py --load gains.json --plot

# Web interface
streamlit run streamlit_app.py

# Run tests
python run_tests.py

See QUICK_REFERENCE.md for full command reference.

Controllers OverviewÂ¶

Controller

Best For

Computational Cost

Chattering

Classical SMC

Prototyping, known systems

Low

Moderate

Super-Twisting SMC

Chattering-sensitive apps

Medium

None

Adaptive SMC

Uncertain/varying systems

Medium-High

Low

Hybrid Adaptive STA

High-performance control

High

None

Decision Tree:

  • Need smooth control? â†’ Super-Twisting or Hybrid

  • Parameter uncertainty? â†’ Adaptive or Hybrid

  • Simplicity priority? â†’ Classical

  • Best overall? â†’ Hybrid Adaptive STA

Interactive Performance ComparisonÂ¶

Visual comparison of controller performance across key metrics:

Key Performance Metrics:

  • Settling Time: Classical SMC leads with fastest convergence (lowest settling time)

  • Computational Efficiency: All controllers achieve real-time performance (<10ms per timestep)

  • Stability: Hybrid Adaptive-STA provides best robustness to disturbances

  • Overshoot: STA-SMC and Classical SMC show superior tracking performance

Interactive Dashboards:

For detailed performance analysis with all 6 chart types, see:

  • ğŸ“Š Full Interactive Dashboard - Comprehensive 6-chart performance overview

  • ğŸ“ˆ Individual Chart Pages - Focused single-chart visualizations

Key ConceptsÂ¶

SystemÂ¶

  • DIP (Double-Inverted Pendulum): Two pendulums on a cart, 6-state system

  • Underactuated: 3 DOF, 1 control input (cart force)

  • Unstable equilibrium: Both pendulums vertical

ControlÂ¶

  • SMC (Sliding Mode Control): Nonlinear control with sliding surface

  • Sliding Surface: s = kâ‚Î¸â‚ + kâ‚‚dÎ¸â‚ + Î»â‚Î¸â‚‚ + Î»â‚‚dÎ¸â‚‚

  • Chattering: High-frequency oscillations from discontinuous switching

OptimizationÂ¶

  • PSO (Particle Swarm Optimization): Bio-inspired algorithm for gain tuning

  • Swarm: Collection of candidate solutions (particles)

  • Convergence: Process of finding optimal gains (typically 50-100 iterations)

MetricsÂ¶

  • ISE: Integral Squared Error (tracking accuracy)

  • ITAE: Integral Time-Absolute Error (convergence speed)

  • Settling Time: Time to reach Â±5% of setpoint

  • Overshoot: Peak deviation beyond setpoint

TroubleshootingÂ¶

Simulation Wonâ€™t RunÂ¶

  1. Check Python version: python --version (need â‰¥3.9)

  2. Verify installation: pip list | findstr numpy

  3. Check working directory: Must be project root

PSO Not ConvergingÂ¶

  1. Increase iterations: --override "pso.iters=200"

  2. Widen bounds in config.yaml

  3. Try different random seed: --seed 123

Performance IssuesÂ¶

  1. Use simplified dynamics: --override "use_full_dynamics=false"

  2. Reduce simulation duration: --override "simulation.duration=3.0"

  3. Increase timestep: --override "simulation.dt=0.02" (test stability)

See User Guide - Troubleshooting for complete guide.

@software{dip_smc_pso_2025,
